COMMUNICATIONS CLOUD
Customize Your Multiplay Subscription Management Implementation

When you've configured your integrations and added users with the appropriate roles, you can start using Multiplay Subscription Management workflows. All the installed workflows are available with default configuration and functionality. Depending on your business requirements, you might want to customize some of the workflows to provide specific functionality.

This section provides detailed information about the core components that are used in Multiplay Subscription Management as well as information about the integration with Matrixx using Matrixx APIs. This section also describes the built-in frameworks used by Multiplay Subscription Management. This information is intended to help you to design and implement extensions, modifications, and customizations to the default functionality of Multiplay Subscription Management.

Customize the Agent Console for Multiplay Subscription Management
The agent console is designed to be highly flexible to make it easy for you to extend and customize each section. Here's a list of the FlexCards used in the agent console along with information about customizing various sections displayed in the agent console.
Customize the Customer Self-Service Portal
The customer self-service portal is designed to be highly flexible to make it easy for you to extend and customize each section. Here's a list of the FlexCards used in the customer self-service portal along with information about customizing various sections displayed in the customer self-service portal.
Customize the Next Best Action Section of the Agent Console
In Multiplay Subscription Management, we use Einstein Discovery and Tableau CRM to analyze subscriber data and calculate a churn score. The churn score indicates how likely it is that a subscriber will terminate their subscription in the next three months.
Custom Metadata Types and Records Used in Multiplay Subscription Management
In Multiplay Subscription Management, we use specific custom metadata types and records to do several different things. We use some of the custom metadata records to hold org-specific information such as profile IDs, the site URL, and so on. We use a different type of custom metadata to specify things like the actions listed in the Actions menu on the agent console and in the customer portal. We also use custom metadata to represent the product model so that it can be understood by the abstraction framework.
Add, Modify, or Remove Items from the Actions Menus on the Agent Console
On the agent console, you can see an Actions menu in the customer's account section and another Actions menu in the subscriptions section. Launching a workflow from the account section allows you to select the subscription that you want to act on, while launching a workflow from the subscription section enables you to act on the relevant subscription directly.
Add, Modify, or Remove Workflows on the Customer Portal
On the customer portal, workflows available to logged in subscribers are listed on the right. Clicking one of these workflows launches the associated OmniScript. The workflows listed here and the OmniScript launched by each workflow are determined by custom metadata records in your org.
Create Agent Users with a Custom Profile
When you get started with Multiplay Subscription Management, the recommended default configuration sets you up to create agent users with the Service Agent profile. In your org, workflows are executed based on the permissions associated with that profile. However, depending on your business requirements, you might want to associate a different profile with the agent users in your org. Here's how you can do that.
Enable or Disable the Demo Flag
In Multiplay Subscription Management the Demo_Flag custom metadata record is used to let you run certain workflows in demo mode. When you enable the demo flag, you can run the cash and voucher top-up workflows without connecting to a Matrixx instance. In this scenario, balances are displayed based on static, demo data.
Customize the Sender's Address for Outgoing Emails
When an agent registers a subscriber, Multiplay Subscription Management sends an email to the new subscriber with instructions for them to reset their password. And when users click the forgot password link on the customer self service portal, an email is sent to them to allow them to reset their password. These emails display a sender email ID that is specified at an org wide level. If required, you can customize this email ID.
Enable or Disable Subscription Tracking on Products
Multiplay Subscription Management lets you enable or disable the use of subscriptions to track assets. Subscription tracking determines whether assets or subscriptions are used to show information and drive workflows.
Core Components in Multiplay Subscription Management
Many of the core components used in Multiplay Subscription Management are designed as reusable components. Creating and using reusable core components minimizes both development and maintenance effort. Reusable components include OmniScripts, Integration Procedures, Data Mappers, and Apex classes. Reusable components can be used across multiple workflows that require common procedures such as determining a user's role, fetching data, making payments, updating object attributes, and so on.
Matrixx APIs for Multiplay Subscription Management
Multiplay Subscription Management uses Matrixx Online Charging System (OCS) for mobile subscriptions. Various workflows require integration with an associated Matrixx instance using Matrixx APIs.
Abstraction Framework
The abstraction framework is a blackbox service that provides an interface between the Multiplay Subscription Management product model and the core components (such as the OmniScripts and Integration Procedures) that interact with the product model.
Eligibility Framework in Multiplay Subscription Management
Many of the workflows in Multiplay Subscription Management can be completed only when certain specific conditions are met. For example, subscribers can buy add-ons, top up their subscription, or activate and deactivate services only if their account status is active and the corresponding SIM card is not suspended. Other specific subscriber requests could be subject to various specific preconditions or rules, which could vary depending on the use case and your business processes.
Customize Guided Selling in Multiplay Subscription Management
The Guided Selling flow is highly customizable, such as the information displayed, the stored information, selection criteria, and so on. The Guided Selling flow has two primary subflows:
Bulk Upload Data v2
To create accounts and underlying subscription data, you can upload a .csv file with the relevant information. The tool or utility can help load data for testing purposes or as reference for demos. This version is used in CME Spring '22 and later.
